description: Fully funded Centrally Sponsored Scheme introduced on 15 August 1995, extending financial support to individuals living below poverty line across rural and urban areas. Covers old age pension, widow pension, disability pension, and family benefit.
target_beneficiaries: Persons with severe/multiple disabilities aged 18-79 years
Senior citizens eligible for pension but not receiving it

eligibility.income_limit: Below Poverty Line families as per SECC data
other_conditions: Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme: Age 60+ years
Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme: Age 40-79 years, widow
Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme: Age 18-79 years, severe/multiple disability (80% or more)
National Family Benefit Scheme: Deceased primary breadwinner aged 18-59 years
Annapurna Scheme: Senior citizen eligible for IGNOAPS but not receiving pension

required_documents: Death certificate of primary breadwinner (for NFBS)
benefits: Annapurna: 10 kg food grains per month free of cost
States/UTs provide top-up ranging from ₹50 to ₹5,700/month

steps: Beneficiary submits application to local body
Verification by Gram Panchayat/Urban Local Body
